course.subject: MATH
course.name: Independent Study: Mathematical Models in Economics: Voting and Matching
course.description: This topic course provides student an opportunity to integrate and apply mathematical tools to analyze problems in economics and social science. The topics include (i) fair allocations, (ii) matching schemes, (iii) voting methods and social choice theory, (iv) proportional representation and apportionment schemes. The student is required to do oral presentation of selected technical papers on these topics and work on some homework problems. Students should seek instructor's approval to take this course.
